name: Archery
description: Archery involves using a bow to shoot arrows at a target.
types: Target archery (distance shooting at stationary targets)
Field archery (shooting at various targets in outdoor settings)

name: Badminton
description: A racquet sport played with a shuttlecock (birdie) over a net.

name: Basketball
description: A team sport played on a rectangular court, aiming to score points by shooting a ball through a hoop.
types: 3x3 basketball (played with 3 players per team on a half-court)

name: Boxing
description: A combat sport where two participants throw punches at each other within a boxing ring.

name: Cycling BMX Freestyle
description: Freestyle BMX involves performing tricks and stunts on specially designed BMX bikes.

name: Cycling Track
description: Track cycling involves racing on a banked oval track, typically indoors.

name: Fencing
description: Fencing is a combat sport where participants use bladed weapons to score points on their opponent.

name: Judo
description: Judo is a martial arts and combat sport focusing on throws and grappling techniques.
types: Matches are won by ippon (full point)

name: Karate
description: Karate is a martial art involving striking, kicking, knee and elbow strikes, and open-handed techniques.
types: Various styles exist, including Shotokan, Wado-ryu, and Goju-ryu.

name: Sailing
description: Sailing involves using wind to propel a boat across water.
types: Different classes of boats exist, such as dinghies, keelboats, and multihulls
Racing formats include fleet racing and match racing

name: Shooting
description: Shooting sports involve using firearms or air guns to hit targets.

name: Tennis
description: Tennis is a racket sport played individually (singles) or in pairs (doubles), hitting a ball over a net.
types: Court types include grass, clay, and hard courts
Matches won by games and sets

name: Wrestling
description: Wrestling is a combat sport involving grappling techniques such as throws and pins.
types: Freestyle wrestling (common in the Olympics, allowing holds above and below the waist)
Greco-Roman wrestling (restricts holds to above the waist)
